subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman program using J. F. Colson's mapping
msgSnippet: Sorry, just checked my email. I am using Hotmail, at it did work for me. It came through in perfect Quickscript.  I m not sure that I can type into Hotmail in
messageBody:
Sorry, just checked my email. I am using Hotmail, at it did work for me. It
came through in perfect Quickscript. I'm not sure that I can type into
Hotmail in QuickScript, but it's not a big deal to cut and paste.

I am not confident of my Quickscript without a cheat sheet, which is at
work. So, I will make my next post in Quickscript.

Sounds great to have someone to practice with.

Paul


>From: "Paige Gabhart" Reply-To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com To: Subject:
>RE: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman program using J.
>F. Colson's mapping Date: Sun, 14 Aug 2005 10:19:08 -0400
>
>Thanks for the reply. The interesting thing is the correct key strokes are
>still embedded in the message. If one simply copies the message, it can
>then be pasted into a word processor (assuming one has the proper font,
>which was Kingsley in this case) and it will appear in QS. This is not an
>elegant solution, but it works. I tried it with the copy of my e-mail, and
>it is perfect. (see note below) So if someone wants to send messages in
>QS, the rest of the group could read it and still use it for practice
>reading if they don't mind copying it into their word processor.
>
>Anyone interested?
>
>
>Paige
>
>Note: Well, not perfect, as after I wrote it, I was still messing around
>with the keyman keyboard mapping and managed, inadvertently, to put in a
>mistake or two. I also left the namer dot off Mr. Colson's name.
>
>-----Original Message----- From: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
>[mailto:Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
>yahoo.5.haelo@... Sent: Saturday, August 13, 2005 7:12 PM To:
>Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of
>Kingsley font with Keyman program using J. F. Colson's mapping
>
>It does not work via email, it seems, and this is one that understands HTML
>email (unfortunately).
>
>-Av
>
>On 05225, at 1556, Paige Gabhart - pgabhart@... wrote:
>
> > > > Please let me know if the following comes through in the Kingsley >
>font. It is my understanding that browsers may cause problems with > this
>sort of thing. If it works, however, we could avoid the > Ikonboard and
>the reported problems with spambots and still > practice QS. > > > > > > if
>His wxks, F wil bI mFtulI sxprFzd. His I-mEl waz ritan wi[T H / > kINzlI
>foGt VzMN Ha kIbPd mApIMN devFzd bF mr kOlsan. > > > > /pEJ
>
>
>
>
>
> _____
>

Sorry, just checked my email. I am using Hotmail, at it did work for me. It 
came through in perfect Quickscript.  I'm not sure that I can type into 
Hotmail in QuickScript, but it's not a big deal to cut and paste.

I am not confident of my Quickscript without a cheat sheet, which is at 
work. So, I will make my next post in Quickscript.

Sounds great to have someone to practice with.

Paul
